author: Joseph De Avila
title: Connecticut Governor Proposes Raising Gas Tax, Adding Highway Tolls
text:
Connecticut Gov. Dannel Malloy on Wednesday proposed raising gas taxes and implementing highway tolls to infuse much-needed cash into the stateâ€™s special transportation fund and help restart work on highway and bridge improvements.
Mr. Malloy, a Democrat, called for increasing the gas tax from 25 cents to 32 cents over a four-year period. He also wants a statewide electronic tolling system up and running by June 2022.
